verbs.description: Rachel Maddow [V: was] overcome with emotion on Tuesday ’s episode of The Rachel Maddow Show , breaking down in tears as she ended her show by attempting to read a breaking news bulletin from the Associated Press regarding the Trump administration ’s policy of forcibly separating babies from their parents at the U.S .- Mexico border . “ This is incredible , Trump administration officials have been sending babies and other young children … ” Maddow said before getting choked up live on air . “ To at least three … ” she continued after a few moments , only to pause again . “ Put up the graphic of this , thank you , ” Maddow asked her staff in attempts to move the camera off her . “ Do we have it ? No , ” she stated before trying to continue to read the report . “ … Three ‘ tender age’ shelters . Lawyers and medical providers — [ another pause as tears well up in her eyes ] I think I ’m going to have to hand this off . Sorry , that does it for us tonight . We ’ll see you tomorrow , ” she said before passing the broadcast on to Lawrence O’Donnell , who hosts the 10 p.m. ET hour on MSBC . .@maddow ’s emotions are what true Americans are all feeling hearing this news pic.twitter.com / r0UOli6yn8— Patrick Gomez ( @PatrickGomezLA ) June 20 , 2018 O’Donnell finished reading the news live from Brownsville , Texas , where he was brodcasting from Tuesday . Maddow tweeted about her emotional breakdown later in the evening : “ Ugh , I ’m sorry , ” she wrote . “ If nothing else , it is my job to actually be able to speak while I ’m on TV … Again , I apologize for losing it there for a moment . Not the way I intended that to go , not by a mile . ” Ugh , I 'm sorry . If nothing else , it is my job to actually be able to speak while I 'm on TV . What I was trying to do -- when I suddenly could n't say / do anything -- was read this lede : 1/6— Rachel Maddow MSNBC ( @maddow ) June 20 , 2018
